awd_titl_txt: Travel Support: 15th International Symposium on Bioinformatics Research and Applications
awd_abstract_narration:
The International Symposium on Bioinformatics Research and Applications (ISBRA)  has a track record of driving informatics research by providing a forum for discussion of latest results in all aspects of bioinformatics and computational biology and applications.  The 15th ISBRA will be held in Barcelona, Spain in June.  A distinguished set of international leaders will provide the keynotes and the students will have an opportunity to present their research in posters sessions. The funds will provide for student travel support for participation in the  technical program as well as in tutorials and poster sessions.  Extended abstracts are published by Springer-Verlag and full papers will be published by the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers.

The interface between computer science and the biological sciences has been one of the most fruitful areas of interdisciplinary research.  The current ISBRA meeting will provide an opportunity for students to meet in a variety of situations with both colleagues and world leaders and enhance overall professional development for the next generation of scientific leaders.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering

inst.inst_name: Georgia State University Research Foundation, Inc.
inst.org_lgl_bus_name: GEORGIA STATE UNIVERSITY RESEARCH FOUNDATION INC

por.por_cntn:
The 15th  International Symposium on Bioinformatics Research and Applications (ISBRA 2019) was held at the Technical University of Catalonia in Barcelona, Spain from June 3 to June 6, 2019, the 18th ISBRA was held at the University of Haifa in Haifa, Israel from  November 14 to November 17, 2022, and 19th ISBRA  was held at the Łukasiewicz Research Network - PORT Polish Center for Technology Development in Wrocław, Poland from  October 9 to November 12, 2023.

The conferences were very successful as reported by the participating researchers, developers, and practitioners working on all aspects of bioinformatics and computational biology and their applications. ISBRA 2019 - 2022 ISBRA  drew over 90 attendees and each from  Bangladesh, Belarus, Brazil, Canada, China (including Hong Kong), Colombia, Finland, France, Germany, Great Britain, Israel, Japan, Poland, Russia, Saudi Arabia, Spain, Switzerland,  and the United States. Each of ISBRA 2019-2022 featured more than 60 oral presentations based on the papers selected by the program committee, 5-6 keynote talks from distinguished scientists. Proceedings of each ISBRA edition were published by Springer and extended verions of talks were published in multiple special issues of reputable journals.

All the talks were well attended and appreciated. The social events were also a big success! Funds from NSF were used to support  post-docs and graduate students who represented multiple universities from the United States. The average support was $1000. The intellectual merit of this project lies in its goal of bringing together scientists in various areas of bio and medical sciences and fostering collaborations among them.


Last Modified: 02/16/2024
Modified by: Aleksandr Z Zelikovskiy
